newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Oct house materials prices rise.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Oct house materials prices rise.

text.p: Australian house building materials prices rose 0.2 percent in October from the previous month and were 0.1 percent lower than a year earlier, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said on Thursday.
Other building materials prices were up 0.1 percent in October for an annual rise of 0.1 percent.
The bureau said the monthly rise in housing materials price index was fuelled by an increase in prices for aluminium doors and windows.
The small rise in the non-housing materials index was mainly due to increases in prices for structural steel and for sprinklers and hydrant systems, the bureau said.
Both indexes were slightly offset by a decrease in prices for pipes and fittings resulting from a drop in world copper prices, it said.
